items.content: Important Detail: the partner is Hightouch.

Hi Gladys,

A couple of questions:

Do you know if there's a way for us to view the data and/or a reference file from Hightouch that's being sent to TikTok?

Can they confirm that these are the steps they're taking to upload the Audience files from Hightouch? https://hightouch.com/docs/destinations/tiktok

Thanks!

Robbie

To provide some more context into the possible issue:

Our match rates can vary based on the customer file the client uploads, and although, for example, 10,000 may seem like a lot of data listed, it may be small when our match rates are lower. For example, lists with data sets containing email addresses tend to process with a match-rate of only 5% or so. One reason for low match rates can be the partial coverage of these identifiers by TikTok users. We always keep the user experience at the center of our products. We do not enforce email and phone number collection from all users, and users can opt out of having their device identifiers collected. As a result, we are only able to match a portion of users based on matching keys for targeting purposes.


Overall, there could be several common issues when an audience list is uploaded but the number of matches is lower than expected, such as:


  • Mixing different hashing methods in one file
  • Hashing wrong values
  • Uploading not what was picked in the dropdown
  • Data issues such as multiple values in some lines
  • Incorrect format
  • Corrupted values (meaning, not matching any type)


They may want to try and upload a list with original values, remove duplicates, and make sure that they are only uploading device identifiers, phone numbers, and/or email addresses. They may also need to increase the number of identifiers they are uploading, expanding the volume of data by 3 to 5 times. Most importantly, all audiences must contain at least 1,000 user matches in order to be usable for future campaigns, etc. (which shouldn't be an issue for them!)

Hi Robbie,


This is a partner file so based on what we have read on the comms, the upload should accept all identifiers. During a call with the client yesterday, they confirmed there is no way to select email or phone, which means there is no "multi-identifier" selection either.


Is there no way for our team to review the input? In the past, a different client found out their partner was sending duplicates and they had faulty coding.


GG
Can you also help us understand what "partial coverage of these identifiers" would do if they do upload multiple identifiers? Wouldn't one identifier suffice?

Hi Gladys,

If a different client found out their partner was sending duplicates and found faulty coding, would Blizzard be able to reach out to Hightouch to get this same kind of information since they own the configuration? They may be able to ask Hightouch directly for an output of the audience file or some kind of logging.

"Partial coverage of these identifiers" means that in some cases, a client may not have both an hashed Email or a Phone number. In the cases that a user in the audience file/feed only has a hashed Phone number tied to them but we only have a Hashed Email address on the TikTok side to make a match, then this will be partial coverage. Although we know this user is present in the feed and in our TikTok account, the hashed signals we have (audience feed only has a hashed phone, we only have a hashed email) will not allow for an audience match.

And apologies for the confusion/inconvenience here; I've also reached out to my manager Jason Schnack and he mentioned that moving forward, all audience tickets should go to the standard internal TPS platform. However, I can still continue working on this ticket for you in the meantime.

Thanks!

Robbie

Hi Robbie,


Thank you. I shared your checklist of issues with the client. First, our main POC mentioned that the test audience 181332341 is now populating significant volume and this is what was different:

"old sync had the phone mapped to a leading 0s, but got fixed to use E.164 standards after original sync

new sync sent E.164 phone standards from start"


But then after we got this, there was an email from their tech guy. I have put all his feedback in this document:


https://bytedance.us.larkoffice.com/docx/J6MIdY8E4owjWtx2iEVujj6Iskb


The main ask now is if there is a way you can confirm 13 million records were sent.


Please let me know if you want to review or if you have trouble following, I know it's a lot.


Thanks!


GG

Hi Robbie,


Per our Lark chat, we would also like to understand the logistics in why these audiences of millions of records pick up in size days later vs in 24 hours. We seem to be the only partner with this issue.


Thanks!
[Conclusion] Ticket should have initially gone to TPS but ultimately handled by assigned SE to account. Ticket and task was accepted initially in good faith since the SE was out at this time

items.label: Reason for request: Please briefly describe the help needed for this account.
items.content:
This issue is with Partner audience sizes and their match rate when selecting them on the ad groups. Blizzard claims they used to get around 50% of the total matched by Meta and that this is not working the same anymore.

Here is the link to the Audience Manager:
https://ads.tiktok.com/i18n/dmp/adver/main?aadvid=7010898827309776898

The audience in question is HT_1PD_Blizzard_D4_D4 Lapsed_WW_202312 , 
ID is 181332204

They are saying this audience should have at least 1.5M users, but it has a little over 500k
But even if they accept the 500k, when selecting on the ad groups, they only get 50k.
They confirmed there are no other countries there but US CA


I have a feeling this has to do with it being a Partner audience, not customer file, and there is an issue with the partner.

Please let me know if you have any questions to help us resolve this.

Thanks!

GG
